data.title: MATTI MANUSHULU – People of the Soil – Photo Exhibition.

data.text:
MATTI MANUSHULU – People of the Soil

Photo Exhibition – Glimpses into life in rural Telangana.

Presented by

Rang De, India

Rang De, India’s first low-cost online crowd funding platform that provides micro credit to entrepreneurs is organizing Matti Manushulu:People of the Soil, a group exhibition featuring the photography of SaurabhChatterjee(a leading photographer featured in The National Geographic Traveller) and others. The week long exhibition will be held inHyderabad and Bangalore and all the proceeds from the sales will go towards supporting a Farmer’s Producer Company in the Mahbubnagar district of Telengana.

The photographs on display take us on a remarkable journey through Hasnabadvillage, the lives of its people and showcase beautiful vistas of women farmers at work in the field. The spectacular portrayal of life in rural Telangana is a treat for photography enthusiasts, socially conscious individuals and those interested in learning more about rural India alike.

The exhibition will be inaugurated in Hyderabad at Lamakaanon August 13 by the founding team of ALC India, an organization that strives to improve the lives of producers. The Bangalore edition will be unveiled at the Rangoli Metro Art Gallery byStan Thekaekara, Founder Director of Just Change, a radical trade model linking producers, consumers and investors in a mutually beneficial, equitable cooperative.

The exhibition also features photographs by Abhinaba Chatterjee, Jan Radtke, Naresh kumar Mani, Gayatri A, Sravan Patsa, Amarnath Madari, Laxman Kukudala, VasuDev, Raamachandhiran, and Nagrika Desai. This one-of-its-kind exhibition aims to create awareness and draw attention towards women farmers and their quest for financial freedom and also enables visitors to make an impact in the in the lives of the people they see in the photographs.

Earlier in June, a Rang De social investor Saurabh Chatterjee had organised a workshop for 13 amateur photographers in Mahbubnagar, Hyderabad where Rang De has supported a 900-strong women producer company with a Rs 20-lakh working capital loan.

About Rang De

Rang De is a Bangalore-based non-profit online peer to peer platform that has successfully used a peer-to-peer lending model to benefit a diversity of people across India. It is India’s first low-cost online crowd funding platform that provides microcredit to low income entrepreneurs and students.

Matti Manushulu on view from 13th Aug to 21st Aug 2016 | 10:00 AM to 7.30 PM

at

Lamakaan,

Off Road No. 1, Banjara Hills,

Opposite GVK One,

Hyderabad.
